drg_flares.settings.title: DRG Flares Settings
drg_flares.settings.about.title: §fAbout DRG Flares
drg_flares.settings.about.text:
§a§oDid I hear a Rock and Stone?§r
 
This mod introduces High-Intensity Flares from Deep Rock Galactic into Minecraft
 
Flares are throwable temporary light sources which bounce off of surfaces
 
After %d seconds, a flare will partially lose its brightness,
and after additional %d seconds it will fizzle out completely
 
For the performance purposes, %d seconds later a fizzled out flare will despawn
 
Can be used as a Client-Side-Only mod with flares visible only to you and not synced between players
drg_flares.settings.disabled_by_server:
§dYou've joined a server with DRG Flares mod installed
and its server-side settings are in effect.
The following settings are server-side and affect all players
drg_flares.settings.server_desc: The following settings are server-side and affect all players
drg_flares.settings.server_desc_client_o:
§eYou're playing on a server without DRG Flares mod installed.
Flares are visible only to you and aren't synced between players.
Survival Flares and Server-Side Light Sources are disabled
drg_flares.settings.regenerating_flares_:
Flares regenerate over time and can
be thrown with a press of a button
drg_flares.settings.regenerating_flare_r:
Sets the flare regeneration period
§eRequires "Regenerating Flares"
§bSet to 0 for unlimited flares in Survival
drg_flares.settings.regenerating_flare_m:
Max amount of Regenerating Flares
you can hold at any given time
§eRequires "Regenerating Flares"
§bSet to 0 for unlimited flares in Survival
drg_flares.settings.flare_recipes_in_sur:
Allows to craft Flare Items in Survival, use them from
your inventory and fire from Dispensers
 
If Regenerating Flares are disabled,
"Throw Flare" keybind will throw a Survival Flare item if available
 
§eRequires a restart to apply
drg_flares.settings.flare_entity_limit_p:
Too many entities (which flares are) may cause lag
 
Each player has their own threshold, after exceeding which
their oldest flares will get deleted
 
Flares of non-player origin (e.g. a dispenser or modded things)
go into their own shared pool
 
§bSet to 0 for Unlimited
drg_flares.settings.flare_throw_angle.de:
By default, a flare gets thrown at a slightly
higher angle than set by the crosshair
 
This effect gets scaled down as the aiming angle gets higher
drg_flares.settings.light_source_lifespa:
Flying flares leave fake invisible light sources behind
to achieve its ability to light things up
 
This value sets for how long said lights should stay
 
Doesn't affect idling flares, since they create a light source
as close to the flare as possible, and only once
drg_flares.settings.light_source_refresh:
Flying flares leave fake invisible light sources behind
to achieve its ability to light things up
 
This value sets the max distance between the flare
and the old light source at which a new light source won't be created
 
Doesn't affect idling flares, since they create a light source
as close to the flare as possible, and only once
drg_flares.settings.light_source_search_: Light Source Free Space Search Distance
The maximum cubic distance from a flare it will search for a valid space to put a Light Source
drg_flares.settings.seconds_until_idling:
Flares' movement rarely needs
to be calculated after it lands
 
This sets the threshold when
an idling Flare disables movement calculation
 
§bSet to 0 to disable idle optimization
drg_flares.settings.seconds_until_dimmin:
Flare starts at its max brightness
and dims out after a set period of time
drg_flares.settings.and_then_seconds_unt: ... and then Seconds Until Fizzling Out

After being dimmed out for a set period of time,
a flare fizzles out completely
 
§eAdditive with "Seconds Until Dimming Out"

After being fizzled for a set period of time,
a flare despawns
 
§eAdditive with "Seconds Until Fizzling Out"
drg_flares.settings.full_brightness_ligh: Light level a flare emits after being thrown
drg_flares.settings.dimmed_light_level.d: Light level a flare emits when dimmed out
drg_flares.settings.creative_unlimited_r:
Allows unlimited Regenerating Flares in Creative Mode
§eRequires "Regenerating Flares"
drg_flares.settings.server_side_light_so:
We don't need temporary light sources from flares
to exist on the server side
 
While it COULD be useful for temporal mob-proofing,
enabling it lowers server performance, flares may interfere
with the flow of liquids or cause observers to fire
drg_flares.settings.flare_ui_x.desc: Horizontal position of the Flare UI widget
drg_flares.settings.flare_ui_y.desc: Vertical position of the Flare UI widget
drg_flares.settings.flare_button_hint.de:
Display the key assigned to throwing a flare on the HUD
§eThe hint won't be displayed for non-letter keybinds
